senses.sense_definition: To stop the playback of a video, audio, or game temporarily so that it can be resumed from the same point later.

examples.text: Please <w>pause</w> the movie while I go to the kitchen.
He <w>paused</w> the game to answer his phone.

senses.sense_definition: To stop doing something or speaking for a short time before continuing.

examples.text: The speaker <w>paused</w> for a moment to drink some water.
She <w>paused</w> to catch her breath after running up the stairs.

senses.sense_definition: To hesitate or hold back from acting because of doubt or to consider something.

examples.text: The strange noise made him <w>pause</w> before opening the door.
I <w>paused</w> when I realized I had forgotten my keys.

senses.sense_definition: A button or control on an electronic device that temporarily stops a recording, video, or game.

examples.text: Press the <w>pause</w> button if you need to leave the room.
I hit <w>pause</w> so we could talk without missing the show.

senses.sense_definition: A short period of time during which something stops or ceases before continuing; a temporary break or interruption.

examples.text: There was a long <w>pause</w> in the conversation while he thought of an answer.
After a brief <w>pause</w>, the music started playing again.

senses.sense_definition: A feeling of hesitation, doubt, or suspension of action, often caused by a serious thought or concern.

examples.text: The potential risks of the plan gave us <w>pause</w>.
His comments gave me <w>pause</w> for thought about the future.

senses.sense_definition: Used immediately after a statement to clarify that no sexual innuendo or homosexual meaning was intended.

examples.text: I really love spending time with you guys, <w>pause</w>.
He said the hot dog was huge, <w>pause</w>, and everyone laughed.
